html.p: What: Make up data to work with. Two main uses:

ol.li: Generate events to work with (often for testing)
Make sure you have at least one row to work with for stats to group/reduce.

html.p: Why: Makeresults can enumerate exactly what you give it, or it can be a true generating command
So what: We're going to use makeresults for many of the examples in this workshop

The examples we are using for this command: | makeresults | makeresults format=csv data="user, dept Rich, IT David, Sales"
| makeresults count=7 | streamstats count | eval cars=round(random()/random(),0), _time=_time-(count*3600) | fields _time, cars | rename cars AS "Cars Sold This Hour" | reverse
| makeresults format=json data="[{\"name\":\"John\", \"age\":35}, {\"name\":\"Sarah\", \"age\":39}]"

search.query: | makeresults format=csv data="user, dept Rich, IT David, Sales"
| makeresults count=7 | streamstats count | eval cars=round(random()/random(),0), _time=_time-(count*3600) |fields _time, cars | rename cars AS "Cars Sold This Hour"| reverse
